cmd.cites.cmd.second.line.cite: Thorburn, Law of Confidential Business Information § 1:11

prop.head.headtext: Thorburn, Law of Confidential Business Information

prop.head.label.name: Chapter
prop.head.headtext: Confidential Business Information in Historical Context

para.paratext: A trade-mark may be defined as a symbol, consisting of a picture, a label or a word or words applied to the goods of a trader for the purpose of distinguishing them from similar goods of other traders and of identifying them as his or her goods when they are put forward for sale. Both the property and the right to protection are in the symbol and not the ware and/or service sold.[1]
Trade-marks Act, R.S.C. 1985, c. T-13, s. 2, definition “trade-mark”.
